column4: should my iptables chain be empty (does that mean it is accepting everything or nothing)?
yes, unless you have rules it should be empty
whois
you can also ping google.com to see what the ip address is
not sure, check the man pages
they may not allow response to ping.
but I can ping and conenct to the net from any otehr machine behind said router (like this irc session)
and I would know that how? Sounds like you have a connectivity problem with that one server
what does 'route -n' respond with?
same thing
you are routing everything out everywhere...I dont think that will work
and if I read this right...you have three interfaces on the same network?
i am willing to accept that, but this exact same config worked before
one is connected to the switch, the otehr two are connected to other computers routing themselves through the server (using it as a mini 3 port switch)
I don't think that will work.
it did before I upgraded to 8.10 from 8.04
ok
i'm not saying youa re wrong, it is antirely possible that this config shouldn't have worked in the first place
and after upgrading to 8.10, something was "fixed" and thus my bad config stopped working
you say one interface is connected to the switch, that route should be the gateway and the default (dest 0.0.0.0)
each of the other two interfaces should have one ip for a destination, the ip that it is connected to.
and they should not be gateways
